reviews.text:
Great place, but a real toungetwister!

Me and my family were driving by and saw that we were in the village. We had already heard of this but we have never been there in real life. We stopped off to take a look and were quite impressed to see that they had a station house with a cafe and of course the big sign!

The only thing that I would have to complain about is that there is no disabled access to the most famous big sign, although there is 1 on the station house and you can see it from across the platform.

Childhood bucket list item finally ticked off! Be great if the station house was still open with snacks and souvenirs, it's a shame how it isn't. The James Pringle Weavers shop across the car park, however, does more than make up for this.

A memorable experience made even more memorable when you realise the full town name is Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch. Wales, why are your towns like this? That was a joke by the way. (No offence to Wales)

Just got to visit if your in the area to get the picture by the sign. Again a tick in the list of things to do in north wales. Children’s loved weavers old fashioned shop with great old fashioned sweet tubs and welsh wares. Sight see the bridges whilst your there too as they’re quite spectacular.
A lovely station with the famous long name.
